g.text: All objects below are done for the purposes of the syncronous request.
If at same point Node process memory limit is reached we may decide to:
A. Limit the amount of transfers per window and windows per settlement or
B. Move to asyncronous processing where we don't need these objects
contains information about settlement and its current state/reason
holds information about all accounts and their current state/reason
has information about all windows and their current state/reason
has information about all accounts and windows
pendingSettlementCount: <integer>, // count of accounts in PENDING_SETTLEMENT state
settledCount: <integer>, // count of accounts in SETTLED state
notSettledCount: <integer> // count of accounts in NOT_SETTLED state
copy of previous object to be preserved for comparission at the end
: { // same as previous but accessed by account id (derived from
participantCurrencyId_key: { // number used to access the object in map-like style
participantId: participantId, // could be used to reconstruct allParticipants
// will be used to insert new state for settlementParticipantCurrency
: { // same as settlementWindows response object with initial data (derived from
settlementWindowId_key: { // number used to access the object in map-like style
id: settlementWindowId, // same as key value
settlementWindowId_key: { // number used to access the object in map-like style
id: settlementWindowId // same as key value
pendingSettlementCount: <integer>, // count of accounts in PENDING_SETTLEMENT state
settledCount: <integer>, // count of accounts in SETTLED state
notSettledCount: <integer> // count of accounts in NOT_SETTLED state
copy of previous object to be preserved for comparission at the end
participantCurrencyId_key: { // number used to access the object in map-like style
id: participantCurrencyId, // same as key value
windows: [] // array of windows to which the account settlement spans
Make a copy of settlementAccounts into
Make a copy of windowsAccounts into
is used for tracing settlement state and state transition allowance
is helper object, same as previous, providing direct access to account by id
has window information for all windows in the settlement
is used for tracing settlement window state and state transition allowance
is helper object to show the list of windows to which settlement account spans
Now we are ready to process the
= [] // part of the response object that lists the affected participants and respective accounts
= [] // array to collect inserts to the table
= [] // array to log processed accounts and restrict subsequent processing
If the account doesn't match the settlement
If the account doesn't match the participant
If the account has been previosly processed (duplicated in the payload)
All same-state reason insert is allowed (state preserved)
All other state transitions are not permitted
issue the following update in one knex command
Update pointers to current state change ids
Merge ids to prepare for single update command
Update pointers to current state change ids
Update pointer to current state change id
